Content: Which expression is equivalent to √147?
A drummer and a guitarist each wrote songs for their band. The guitarist wrote 8 fewer than twice the number of songs that the drummer wrote. They wrote a total of 46 songs.
Which system of equations models this situation if the drummer wrote d songs and the guitarist wrote g songs?
Which graph best represents the solution set of y ≤ −4x?
The graph of f(x) = x² was transformed to create the graph of g(x) = (x − 7.5)². Which of these describes this transformation?

F.Choice: A horizontal shift to the right 7.5 units

G.Choice: A horizontal shift to the left 7.5 units

Content: A set of weights includes a 4 lb barbell and 6 pairs of weight plates. Each pair of plates weighs 20 lb. If x pairs of plates are added to the barbell, the total weight of the barbell and plates in pounds can be represented by f(x) = 20x + 4.
What is the range of the function for this situation?
The area of a rectangle is 54x⁹y⁸ square yards. If the length of the rectangle is 6x³y⁴ yards, which expression represents the width of the rectangle in yards?
The total number of seats in an auditorium is modeled by f(x) = 2x² − 6x, where x represents the number of rows of seats. How many rows are there in the auditorium if it has a total of 416 seats?
The graph of an exponential function is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/8a.jpg
Which dashed line is an asymptote for the graph?
Which situation best represents causation?

A.Choice: When the number of bus stops increases, the number of car sales decreases.

B.Choice: When fewer firefighters report to a house fire, the damage caused by the fire decreases.

C.Choice: When ice cream sales increase, incidents of sunburn increase.

D.Choice: When it rains several inches, the water level of a lake increases.

Content: The graph of a quadratic function is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/10a.jpg
Which function is best represented by this graph?
What is the solution to 8x − 3(2x − 4) = 3(x − 6)?
A lifeguard earns $320 per week for working 40 hours plus $12 per hour worked over 40 hours. A lifeguard can work a maximum of 60 hours per week.
Which graph best represents the lifeguard's weekly earnings in dollars for working h hours over 40?
A shoe company is going to close one of its two stores and combine all the inventory from both stores. These polynomials represent the inventory in each store:
Store A:	(1/2)g² + 7/2
Store B:	3g² − (4/5)g + 1/4
Which expression represents the combined inventory of the two stores?
The graph of quadratic function f is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/14a.jpg
What is the y-intercept of the graph of f ?
A particular type of cell doubles in number every hour. Which function can be used to find the number of cells present at the end of h hours if there are initially 4 of these cells?
What is the slope of the line represented by 5x − 12y = 24?
Which expression is equivalent to 6x² + 13x + 5?
A bus travels two different routes: the Green Route and the Blue Route. The routes are different lengths.
• On Monday the bus traveled the Green Route 6 times and the Blue Route 5 times, traveling a total of 52 miles.
• On Tuesday the bus traveled the Green Route 12 times and the Blue Route 13 times, traveling a total of 119 miles.
What is the length of the Green Route in miles?
The table shows the heights and the lengths of several rectangles.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/19a.jpg
What does the correlation coefficient for the data indicate about the strength of the linear association between the height and the length of these rectangles?
The expression (x³)(x⁻¹⁷) is equivalent to xⁿ. What is the value of n?
The population of Center City is modeled by exponential function f, where x is the number of years after the year 2015. The graph of f is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/21a.jpg
Which inequality best represents the range of f in this situation?
A sequence can be generated by using aₙ =4a₍ₙ₋₁₎ ,where a₁ = 6 and n is a whole number greater than 1. What are the first four terms in the sequence?
What is the equation in slope-intercept form of the line that passes through the points (−4, 47) and (2, −16)?
The graph of f(x) = x² is transformed to create the graph of h(x) = 2f(x). Which graph best represents f and h?
A student is ordering a flower arrangement. She can choose any combination of roses and carnations for her flower arrangement, and she does not want to spend more than $30.
If roses cost $3 each and carnations cost $2 each, which inequality represents all possible combinations of x roses and y carnations?
The graph models the linear relationship between the temperature of Earth's atmosphere and the altitude above sea level.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/26a.jpg
Which of these best represents the rate of change of the temperature with respect to altitude?
The value of y is directly proportional to the value of x. If y = 35 when x = 140, what is the value of y when x = 70?
Which expression is equivalent to m² − 13m − 30?
The line graphed on the grid represents the first of two equations in a system of linear equations.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/29a.jpg
If the graph of the second equation in the system passes through the points (−12, 20) and (4, 12), which statement is true?

A.Choice: The only solution to the system is (10, 5).

B.Choice: The only solution to the system is (0, 14).

D.Choice: The system has an infinite number of solutions.

Content: What is the domain of f(x) = 9 − x²?
A student used f(x) = 5.00(1.012)ˣ to show how the balance in a savings account will increase over time. What does the 5.00 represent?

A.Choice: The interest the savings account earned for the first year

B.Choice: The annual interest rate of the savings account

C.Choice: The number of years the savings account has earned interest

D.Choice: The starting balance of the savings account

Content: The graph of a function is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/32a.jpg
Which ordered pair best represents the location of the y-intercept?

Researchers in Antarctica discovered a warm sea current under a glacier that is causing the glacier to melt. The ice shelf of the glacier had a thickness of approximately 450 m when it was first discovered. The thickness of the ice shelf is decreasing at an average rate of 0.06 m per day.
Which function can be used to find the thickness of the ice shelf in meters x days since the discovery?
What is the positive solution to the equation 0 = (1/3)x² − 3?
The amount of fertilizer in a landscaping company's warehouse decreases at a rate of 3% per week. The amount of fertilizer in the warehouse was originally 78,000 cubic yards.
Which function models the amount of fertilizer in cubic yards left after w weeks?
What is the equation of the line that passes through the point (−2, 7) and has a slope of zero?
Which ordered pair is in the solution set of y ≥ (1/3)x + 4?
problems/TX17HSA1/media/37a.jpg
Which table does NOT show y as a function of x?
A projectile is launched into the air from the ground. The table shows the height of the projectile, h(t), at different times.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/39a.jpg
Based on the table, which function can best be used to model this situation?
Which value of x makes the equation 0.75(x + 20) = 2 + 0.5(x − 2) true?
Which expression is a factor of 18x² − 15x + 2?
The graph of linear function g is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/42a.jpg
What is the zero of g?
Which quadratic function in vertex form can be represented by the graph that has a vertex at (3, −7) and passes through the point (1, −10)?
The graph of part of linear function g is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/44a.jpg
Which inequality best represents the domain of the part shown?
A student graphed f(x) = x and g(x) = f(x) + 3 on the same coordinate grid. Which statement describes how the graphs of f and g are related?

A.Choice: The graph of f is shifted 3 units up to create the graph of g.

B.Choice: The graph of f is steeper than the graph of g.

C.Choice: The graph of f is shifted 3 units down to create the graph of g.

D.Choice: The graph of f is less steep than the graph of g.

Content: The graph of a quadratic function is shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/46a.jpg
Which equation best represents the axis of symmetry?
If p(x) = 5(x² + 1) + 16, what is the value of p(11)?
The graphs of lines k₁ and k₂ are shown on the grid.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/48a.jpg
Which system of equations is best represented by this graph?
Which statement about the graph of y = (1/3)(2/3)ˣ is true?

A.Choice: The graph has a vertical asymptote.

B.Choice: The graph crosses the y-axis at (0, 2/9).

C.Choice: The graph has an asymptote at y = 1/3.

D.Choice: The graph decreases from left to right.

Content: The table represents some points on the graph of a linear function.
problems/TX17HSA1/media/50a.jpg
Which equation represents the same relationship?
Which expression is equivalent to (7x³)²(x⁸)¹/²?
The function y = 3.75 + 1.5(x − 1) can be used to determine the cost in dollars for a taxi ride of x miles. What is the rate of change of the cost in dollars with respect to the number of miles?
Which graph best represents a function with a range of all real numbers greater than or equal to −6?
What is the value of x in the solution to this system of equations?
